website_summaries.verdict: This is a great choice for those who seek a utility knife with the capacity for self-defense use. Lightweight and compact, but solid in the hand.
pros: Fiberglass-reinforced nylon handle with bi-directional grip
Smaller profile than standard folding models
Blade constructed from advanced ZDP-189 steel

customer_reviews.title: Great little knife by Spyderco
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Spyderco Sage and love it, but have found that some are taken back by the size. The Dragonfly 2 is much smaller and I do not think anyone will be concerned when I take it out of my pocket. Fit and finish are perfect and it is razor sharp.Update. I still love this knife, but because it is small and I am kind of klutzy I have lost two of them. I will probably order another one, but in the mean time I am using one of my Sage knives. They are big enough that I have never lost one.
customer_reviews.author: ahwt

customer_reviews.title: Great blade, cheap handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a an extremely sharp little knife in a great size that feels great in your hand! The big problem is the handle... it is made of FRN which is basically a plastic resin material and it bends and flexes when it shouldn't. It certainly doesn't feel like a quality handle compared to the steel blade. Spyderco should upgrade to G-10 for better durability and stability.
customer_reviews.author: pgaejw

customer_reviews.title: A handy little knife
customer_reviews.text: It is small for convenient pocket or keychain carry but big enough to be useful. It’s well made and robust with the zdp-189 steel being very hard and have great edge holding ability. A polish on 8000 grid stone gave the secondary bevel a nice mirror finish. I have 3 zdp 189 knives and one need a little experimentation to get the good compromise on chip resistance and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfection achieved
customer_reviews.text: I got my first pocket knife at 6 or 7. I have been on a quest since to find the perfect edc, after 25 years, this is it. Unobtrusive, simple, and holds a razor-edge for months of daily use. I have other knives for other purposes, but they will always be carried in addition to this one. If you can only get one knife, make it this one (and a good sharpener).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy one-hand opening
customer_reviews.text: Among my favorites. Easy one-hand opening. Not too difficult to close one-handed once you get the hang of it. Disappears in your pocket. Razor sharp from the box, and holds a great edge. Easier to grip than any knife this size has a right to be - because of the 50/50 choil and perfect texturing on the FRN handle. Nice subtle wire clip holds it tight but doesn't scuff up pockets too badly, and doesn't advertise to the world that you've got a knife. Outstanding fit and finish.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: A beautifully designed and constructed tool
customer_reviews.text: This little knife could easily sit on display in a museum of modern art. Oh, and by the way the blade is razor sharp, the locking mechanism perfect, and the grip is one of the best I have ever felt. The textured fiberglass reinforced nylon grip stays secure in your hand, and is light as a feather. It's a great example of how useful and tough high quality plastics can be. This may be the best small knife design ever- but it's not *too* small. You can do most every-day cutting tasks with it. It's a little short for food prep maybe, but I don't think lot of people do that with pocket knives.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B Goode

customer_reviews.title: One of us! One of us!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a Spyderco before. Several other really nice knives. Many of which are many times mores expensive than this one. I've never found Spyderco knives all that visually appealing, but I succumbed to the hype. It's true what they say. Never buy a Spyderco. Why? Cuz you won't stop! I'm hooked. I traded out my other EDC for this guy, and that one was about 5x as expensive. Do it! Join the cult! Also, I saw the reviews of counterfeits. They looked like they were all the yellow H1's. I got the green one with the fancy steel directly from Amazon. It was legit.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best EDC for "Office Work"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading about the performance of the blade steel and I was not disappointed. ZDP-189 is fantastic, in my opinion it is better than M390, CTS-XHP and CTS 204P. I bought this knife to swop the blade with my G10 Spyderco Dragonfly. I had to do some minor filing with a diamond file to get the blade to lock correctly and it fits great now. When it gets a little dull, which is not often 10 to 15 swipes (each side) on my strop that is loaded with green chrome oxide, at it is hair popping sharp again. I don't think that I will have to hone this blade ever.
customer_reviews.author: Wern

customer_reviews.title: Great Nephew's First-Knife
customer_reviews.text: I wound up getting my nephew the Sypderco Dragonfly which turned out to be a perfect little first knife and I even etched a 'Triforce' into the blade for him! This would make an excellent smaller EDC blade. The blade shape is nice and looks cool. The pocket clip is strong and carries deeply concealed. The others are pretty rad, and it feels REALLY good in the hand. You can choke up on the blade for fine cutting tasks and the over/under choils are nicely tractioned. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Peace, Love and Guns

customer_reviews.title: If youre looking for a daily carry consider the larger delica
customer_reviews.text: Lost the delica and sort of wish i stuck with the bigger bladed delica. However there is nothing wrong with this knife its very ergonomic and whatever else, just a little small for certain situations. One thing that does bother meis the belt clip cannot be moved to the opposite end of the knife and the end bit sticks way out. So anytime you bend forward with this knife it will dig into your stomache.
customer_reviews.author: Faygo Turkey

customer_reviews.title: This is a great lightweight small knife
customer_reviews.text: I like the blade shape and the ability to open quickly. The knife is so lightweight you can forget that it is in your pocket. The blade locks open quickly and locks firmly. The edge from the factory is very sharp and the ZDP-189 high grade steel seems to hold the edge well. I have been using it for cutting tasks around the house and opening packages. It still cuts like new. I plan on touching up the edge, mostly to see how this steel sharpens, not because it is getting dull.
customer_reviews.author: cemclellan

customer_reviews.title: Half year update
customer_reviews.text: After half a year I wanted to take the knife apart for some cleaning and one of the screws just would not budge. After managing to take it out and cleaning the knife, the screw refused to go back in. Had to throw the knife away. Horrible waist of money. Also the knife lost its sharpness in the first month and even after sharpening it remained dull.
customer_reviews.author: Yuval Hermelin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keypocket knife
customer_reviews.text: I have the ZDP version of this knife. Have found it to be the perfect knife to fit in jeans pants key pocket. The clips is awesome and there is no need for a steel liner in this model so it is super light. ZDP holds an edge forever, pay to have it sharpened every year or two. Perefect for regular day tasks can even fit a protac 1aaa in the keypocket with it!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: so light that I forget it is there
customer_reviews.text: zdp-189 has very long edge retention and it can take a keen edge. The knife is feather light and usually I forget I have it. The handle is small but the upper and lower ramps on the blade provide space to get a good hold on the knife. The blade shape is good for slicing and the tip seems very sturdy. The lock back design means that one handed closing is a little difficult, and the speed is slow when opening. Overall this is a great EDC knife. For me, the price was a little steep for such a small knife, but if that is not a problem then this is an amazing knife.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING KNIFE
customer_reviews.text: Ive owned this knife about a week and absolutley love it. Its the best quality blade ive ever owned. The handle is comfy for being so small. I was wrried this knife would be too small but its not. Its great if youre looking for something small shatp and strong for any day to day cutting. The zdp-189 seriously is great stuff. I hope Spyderco puts more knifes out in it.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best carry knife ever
customer_reviews.text: OK. I like knives. In fact I really like knives and this is one of the best. My zero tolerance is just too big and heavy to carry everyday as are my Kershaws. A few of my Spyderco's are a bit large but NOT this model. I have 4 dragonfly's and this one is by far the best. I like the serrated version with either H-1 or VG-10 steels for cutting anything quickly but the ZDP-189 is hard and RAZOR sharp. Scary sharp. Very comfortable to carry and probably won't frighten anyone when opening either. I would imagine some people would freak if I whipped out the Zero Tolerance.
customer_reviews.author: fiddlerboy

customer_reviews.title: This thing's great! Cut myself right out the box
customer_reviews.text: This thing's great! Cut myself right out the box! I needed bandaids anyways. The size is great for edc. You can really choke up on the blade with that awesome finger choil that everyone talks about which leaves a little over an inch of razor sharp blade just feels so precise. I throw my middle finger in the choil and pinch the blade which might be a little untraditional but it feels so secure. I love it. It's also my first spyderco. I'll be back for more eventually
customer_reviews.author: reardan

customer_reviews.title: A seriously great small blade.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Cold Steel Micro I lost. An experiment. I am seriously impressed. This little knife has done everything I have asked of it. It is lighter than some other blades I have of this size but the ease of use, the well designed thumb rest, the smooth lock/unlock has caused to me put this at the top of my use list. I will be looking at other blades by Spyderco. A definite recommend
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Kunzmann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect EDC
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect EDC knife. The clip is great or put it totally in your pocket and you won’t know it’s there. Go with the special edition zdp-189. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L.

customer_reviews.title: All the great things you read about this knife are true.
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a knife cheapskate, there are a ton of very good knives out there for less than half the price of this one. But, I kept reading about what a perfect carry knife this was. I finally gave in, and it is all true. If you are going to buy just one knife to carry, this is that knife. Ultra light and thin it disappears in your pocket. It lives up to Syderco reputation for quality. The ZDP-189 steel gives a new meaning to sharp. And it stays sharp. Every few weeks a quick stropping and that wicked, sharp edge comes right back. A truly great knife
customer_reviews.author: 4strokes

customer_reviews.title: This is the EDC knife you're looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing!! I was stunned at the sharpness of this knife. I have heard nothing but great reviews of Japanese Spyderco knives. So I went out to find one. This is the sharpest knife ever. It is a small knife, but once the blade is out it almost feels large. Perfect for super lightweight EDC and still being able to do almost any job. Get this knife if you are looking at it. The dark green color is the final touch of perfection
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Delivered as promised
customer_reviews.text: Very nice knife and an excellent alternative to the Delica 4 if you work at a place that has a strict no weapons policy.
customer_reviews.author: Furor Vikingorum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Spyderco product
customer_reviews.text: Great little pocket knife with excellent blade. Very handy and dependable lightweight pocket knife when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Small enough that you pretty much forget it’s in your pocket, but big enough to be useful. If you believe the best knife is the one you actually have on you, this will definitely become your best knife. Also, while I have fairly large hands, this knife is easy to grip firmly.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: ZDP-189 rocks
customer_reviews.text: The ZDP-189 steel version of this Dragonfly is great. It holds an edge exceedingly well and for a long time. The Dragonfly model is the perfect side pocket EDC knife in my opinion. You won't be sorry if you buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Leading Edge

customer_reviews.title: Nice, small EDC pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my EDC collection because of the ZDP-189 blade, spydie hole, and the petite size. Removal of the pocket clip leaves you with a slim, light weight blade. Pros: light weight scale surface provides nice grip decent jimping and finger choil blade edge is very sharp blade is dead center between the scales Cons: light duty, no internal metal stiffeners behind the scales (although you probably don't need them in a light duty knife of this size) single hand opening is a little difficult for my large hands
customer_reviews.author: DashDash

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is an awesome purchase. It's tiny yet it fits in your ...
customer_reviews.text: A powerful little EDC. This little guy is an awesome purchase. It's tiny yet it fits in your hand perfectly. The steel is amazing. I own 9 Spydies and I carry this one the most. I purchased 3 as Christmas gifts. I could not recommend this more...get one and you will be a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: everjava

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Knife
customer_reviews.text: When you first handle this knife you will probably think WTF? That's what I thought anyway. It's very small and very light, which could make you think it looks and feels cheap. After a week of EDC this has become one of my favorite EDC knives. If you purchase a Dragonfly2, try to ignore your first impressions. Carry it for a week and then form your opinion. I like it, I recommend it, and I will probably buy two or three more to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: PDH

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I also own a Spyderco Endura 4 with Emerson Wave, a black Delica 4 SpiderEdge and yellow Tasman Salt. I carry the Endura every day in my right pocket. Since my new ZDP-189 Dragonfly 2 (British Racing Green FRN) arrived about a week ago, I've been carrying it clipped in my left pocket. Initial impression is that this is a very nicely made little knife. Great feel in my hand and very, very sharp. Nothing more to say about it at this time except that I'm glad I spent $60 on this little gem. 20 September 2012 Update: After about ten months of occasional use, this thing is still razor sharp. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great sleek, light and compact EDC knife
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Dragonfly 2 and I am loving it. I also have a Spyderco Ambitious knife with the G-10 grip so I wanted to try a sleeker knife with the FRN style. As many reviews have stated, it is incredibly lighter than the other styles of grips. My G-10 does have a sturdier feel to it but I am already liking the FRN better. I also like the back-lock compared to the liner-lock but that's just preference. I went with the ZDP-189 steel just so I don't have to get it sharpened as much and it showed up scary sharp. Overall, I am very happy with this knife!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Wavs

customer_reviews.title: I really like the blade & knife itself
customer_reviews.text: First off, the knife arrived quickly as expected. I really like the blade & knife itself. It came very, very sharp & is small for EDC. I've used it for all kinds of cutting & small tasks, and it has preformed flawlessly. The one bad thing is that the screw that holds the pocket clip in place is constantly coming loose. I may have to try some lock-tight on the screw and see if that helps correct it. Other than that, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic EDC knife. Despite being small and very light, it feels very sturdy, and there is no play in the blade at all when it is locked. It came with a VERY sharp edge, and has no issue cutting through boxes, paper, opening packages, and pretty much everything else I have thrown at it so far. The pocket clip is very tight, and I do not feel like it risks falling out of my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Dennison

customer_reviews.title: This is a great edc knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great edc knife! Small enough to go anywhere, but what really makes this knife shine is the blade! The ZDP-189 is an amazing steel!! Simply put it is out of the box sharp after a month of every day use. I cannot get the edge to roll or dull no matter what I try. It is sure to be the knife I will carry every day for years to come! If you are looking for a great edc knife in a small to spyderco size package you have to look seriously at this combination simply because of the functionality of the steel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ZDP-189 is an amazing knife steel
customer_reviews.text: ZDP-189 is an amazing knife steel. Comes out of the box razor sharp. Accidently shaved some skin off my thumb without bleeding when I tried feeling the keenness of the edge after opening the box for the first time. Now I know not to do that! The FRN scales are grippy and feel good in hand, and the Dragonfly is the perfect size for daily carry.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chen

customer_reviews.title: Overall good knife, should have better fit and finish.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and Finish is only ok. No blade play and the grinds are even. But the jimping is slanted, the blade is not centered, the lock bar has a gap between it and the handle. It came sharp enough to push cut printer paper, but was not hair shaving sharp. I am disappointed that this does not have higher fit and finish however, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Tiny EDC that packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to say that hasn't already been said better in previous reviews. This is a wonderful little knife. You pay something of a premium, but the combination of surprisingly excellent ergonomics and amazing edge retention from the ZDP-189 make it well worth the extra cost. The FRN handles take a lot of flak for feeling like cheap plastic, but the knife is more than sturdy enough. It's not an art piece, but that's fine. It's a highly functional tool, and from the moment I took it out of the box it felt familiar in the hand. Great ergos, great steel, and a tiny profile that disappears in your pocket - it's a winning combination.
customer_reviews.author: gus_hynes

customer_reviews.title: Best small EDC for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing smaller EDC knife. Probably very the best for the size and price point. If you prefer an easier to operate lock and don't mind a thicker knife and spending a bit more then maybe look at the Lil Native with the compression lock.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small EDC
customer_reviews.text: Great little EDC knife. The ZDP-189 steel holds an edge for a long time. I just strop it once a month and it is good to go. Love the ergonomics and control of the knife. Realistically, most people dont need anything bigger than this knife. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect In-role
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically to live in the back pocket of my dress pants for work (front is occupied by an Emerson CQC8 which isn't super work friendly). Sharp as can be and not intimidating to "normal" folk. It's small which some have griped about so if you want a pocket sword look into Cold Steel, that's not the intended purpose for this knife. I have more than enough 3.5"-4.5" blades, this is for opening stuff and detail work. Just remember, "right tool for the right job"... And "guy in a tie with a 3.9" wave-able knife= scary to clients"
customer_reviews.author: S. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Color of handle
customer_reviews.text: i just have a question about the product description: the handle in the add is stated as "british racing green" in color. my handle is black. My apology, I just discovered that I am color blind and can not distinguish between dark colors. The handle is a dark green.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN S CHAPO

customer_reviews.title: My favorite small pocket knife.
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife so much I just bought another one with a different color handle and blade steel. It came razor sharp and the zdp-189 has held up nicely to cutting a lot of cardboard and plastic. The spine and choil jimping give you great control of the knife and make the small handle feel like a full size folder. Folded it is small and super light so you don't even notice it in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Super Sharp Small Office EDC!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little knife, is my EDC. Perfect size for my office job and super sharp. I forget its on most of the time. So far the steel has been impressive however it gets pretty light use. 2 months and still very sharp and no rust. I like and use it more than my delica4. I have big hands and its still comfortable to use, and fast to deploy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: good quality, razor-like sharpness
customer_reviews.text: If you're an "office warrior", this is the only EDC you'll need for all the practical purposes. Lady/Man bug are too small (as well as Recon I Micro). This one has convenient grip, good quality, razor-like sharpness, and not dangerous look at all. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: i_s_t

customer_reviews.title: It's A Spydie.....
customer_reviews.text: Everything I had expected & it's more user friendly than my SS Dragonfly due to the FRN material & grip texturing;way lighter too.Great for Light day carrying. ZDP-189 seems to hold an edge better than VG-10 and touch up very well. This knife gets carried a great deal of the time. Can't think of a better knife in my collection for around the house use...if lost I'd have to replace with same model again. Clipped in my pocket even as I type...nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: 88Keith88

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: You could argue that this is all the knife you will ever need because the design makes the utility of this knife almost limitless despite its size and weight. Still on the fence about ZDP-189 vs VG-10... I'd save a few bucks and buy the VG-10 IMHO. If they made an M4 version I would give them whatever they wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Quaid

customer_reviews.title: My first spyderco
customer_reviews.text: I have collected many knives. I change out my edc about once a year. This was my first spyderco and i am glad i bought it. I may hang onto this one for a lot longer than a year. Perfect size, i thought it would be too small. I have larfe hands but it fits comfortaby in the hand and its perfect to fit in any pocket. The steep is extremely sharp and holds an edge better then any other edc ive had. The pocket clip is also very functional yet simple. It doesnt catch on anything and is extremely durable.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: The best pocket knife I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews online of this knife, I have to agree with everyone that this is the best pocket knife you will ever own.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Sherman

customer_reviews.title: The little knife that could.
customer_reviews.text: The little knife that could. And then they had to go and make it in ZDP-189 and my favorite color. I can't say enough about how useful this little guy is. I'm gonna pick up a salt series one next.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Little Big Knife!
customer_reviews.text: Love this knife. Hair-popping, razor sharp out of the box. Great design makes it small in the pocket, yet when unfolded much more grip than you would expect. Super lightweight, dont even know it is in pocket. The ZDP-189 steel is excellent. Holds an edge after much abuse! Great knife, I have carried it every day since I bought it, won't go anywhere without it.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: The ergonomics allow a decent grip with good controlled of the blade
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small light weight knife, and wanted to try out zpd-189 steel as well. Well, it's definitely compact, and light as a feather. The ergonomics allow a decent grip with good controlled of the blade. And came razor sharp, litterly shaved hairs off my neck like a straight razor, overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Small, lightweight and robust. For me, it’s just a bit small to be my primary choice but it’s definitely a close second. If I’m headed somewhere with a blade length restriction (like the ball park) this is what I bring. Despite it’s relatively small size when folded, it handles great when opened (as many others have mentioned).
customer_reviews.author: M. Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC knife.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't too sure about this specific knife, I have always preferred larger knives but I was extremely please with the amount of use I put this little knife through and it really performs, cutting cardboard, opening letters, and most importantly not scaring my coworkers, it's extremely well made and will I'm highly satisfied with it. Delivery was fast and the product arrived as advertised. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Sal Glesser's magnum opus and in even better ZDP-189 steel. This is a damn near perfect pocket knife.
customer_reviews.author: M. OMALLEY

customer_reviews.title: Loving This Little Knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this little knife. I wanted to try using a knife instead of scissors to cut paracord. So I did my homework and decided to give 'The Spyderco Dragonfly 2 British Tacing Green FRN ZDP-189 PlainEdge Knife' a try. Believe me I was not disappointed This knife fits my hand like a glove. It's just the right size (not too big and not too small). It cuts through paracord like butter and it leaves an even edge. I also used it to open my mail. It's a smooth operator. I bought it for my paracord projects but I see now that I'll be using it for lot's of other tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Good EDC addition
customer_reviews.text: Well made little knife. The handle is big enough. I had some initial concerns about the FRP material but it is working ok for me. It is a little grippy in the pocket but won't likely wear a hole in my pants. The lock is solid.The blade length is legal in all of my routine locations. The ZDP189 blade material is holding up well. Overall it's been a good, working EDC tool.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Best factory edge I have ever received...
customer_reviews.text: Shaving sharp out of the box. Super lightweight, like forget it's there lightweight. Literally carries anywhere. Comfortable grip for it's size thanks to the choil, super grippy handle texture. A bit pricey by my standards for a small folder but I am d@mn happy, so it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC
customer_reviews.text: I really like the knife. I work in an office and wear slacks everyday, so I needed something that was a bit on the smaller side. It's a great size, and the blade hold up very well. I usually switch between this and my SOG Flash II (or maybe just the Flash - whichever one is smaller). The Flash fits and clips to my pocket a little better, but the Spyderco absolutely feels more sturdy in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Value +service is top notch.
customer_reviews.text: The knife arrived in perfect condition ! I think it's the best spyderco I have purchased to date , and I have a ton of them. Order on wed. and it arrived sat . Couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.author: michael howard

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp. Great size
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp. Great size. I don't like having to use two hands to close it. Also the blade comes with some kind of wax on it that was very difficult to get off. The blade it hard to get out with one hand until I put a little oil and loosened the nut a hair. It is my edc due to size and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: gallegon

customer_reviews.title: My default EDC
customer_reviews.text: I have about 10 Spydercos and 60+ other knives of all types and qualities. I never wanted to have a knife of this size as my go-to, daily blade, but it's so good that I can't stop carrying it. The knife is light, accessable, and very sharp; I still carry my Dragonfly even if I'm enjoying or trying another EDC blade. It's the easiest and most reliable edged tool I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Super tiny which made me question, but husband loves it and says it’s a perfect little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Scalpel
customer_reviews.text: This knife hides in a watch pocket until needed then opens to a small but surprisingly usable size. The base of the blade (choil) is textured (jimped) to make extra handle space, allowing for a comfortable grip. The blade was phenomenally sharp right out of the box and has stayed that way through a ridiculous amount of use, mostly against cardboard, wire insulation, envelopes, and popping zip ties. The fit and finish of all the parts is very fine. The blade is a little too short for, say, halving an apple, but any bigger and it wouldn't disappear in your pocket like it does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and sharp
customer_reviews.text: This knife is the perfect size for a small pocket knife. It is easy to open and is super light. The edge on the blade is ridiculously sharp. The best everyday carry I own.
customer_reviews.author: swolesurf

customer_reviews.title: Scary sharp, light weight
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered yesterday afternoon so I don't have a lot of experience with it. I will say it is a delight, sharper than any knife I've ever used. The blade, made of ZDP-189 steel, zips through paper with ease. It opens and closes easily. The knife is small, I have small hands and find it is an excellent fit. If you have huge hands I think you'll find it too small.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Read...donedeal...
customer_reviews.text: My sister sent me a gift card and I got this, wow, what a fine little knife that fits just right in the hand and using all fingers for control, zdp189 is definitely the way to go, does not bother the pocket area when clipped or all in. A friend bought me a Spiderco years ago and it was big, all steel, handles etc. and it was a bit heavy, so only get to carry on occasion, but this Dragonfly2 ?, donedealbeeskneescatzazzfinernfroghair and coolingreen know what I mean?
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: ZDP-189 is no joke.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of the Dragonfly 2 for a long time. Extreme performance to size/weight ratio. Add ZDP-189 to the mix and you've got an even better knife. This thing is like a scalpel and it'll hold that edge for a long, long time. I have a lot of knives, but this Dragonfly 2 and my Benchmade 940-1 are the knives I find in my pocket the most. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: says it's light weight and super sharp. He has a large collection of knives ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as an early x-mas present for my boyfriend. He loves it, says it's light weight and super sharp. He has a large collection of knives and this is now the go-to one.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Small, Light, Easy to carry and use. Stays sharp.
customer_reviews.text: This has become one of my go-to knives for everyday use. Very easy to carry, holds a good edge, sharp out of the box. It's a really small, three finger folder. I normally carried the Delica. I still go back and forth between the two. The Dragonfly feels small compared to the Delica, but it's a very capable small knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great EDC.
customer_reviews.text: I have many folding knives to choose from when i'm carrying. Is it the choice when I feel I need something for substantial protection? No. For everything else, for me, it is just about perfect. Fantasticly sharp out of the box steel. Low weight with zero bladeplay that fits great in the hand, and disappears in the pocket. Having this knife as a choice every morning is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D.

customer_reviews.title: I love this knife!
customer_reviews.text: I have Microtech, Protech and Benchmade knives and until I purchased the ZDP-189 Dragonfly 2, I never considered Spyderco knives to be in the same league, however, the fit and finish of this knife rivals any of the aforementioned. The ZDP-189 steel is everything that it is touted to be, as my Dragonfly easily cut hair, right out to the box. I love this knife and I would recommend it to anyone for EDU and as a matter of fact I think that I will end up purchasing the Nishijin glass fiber version as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Koleff

customer_reviews.title: Perfection in Tiny package.
customer_reviews.text: Just a fabulously small and razor sharp pocket folder. Nothing negative to say here. Great knife that is so small and light you'll forget you have it in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: RCM11

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for summer carry. Don’t lit the size and weight fool you. It’s a serious knife.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for summer carry! Amazingly light and blade was shaving sharp out of the box. Make sure you tighten the clip screws though..mine came loose after a week. Locktight solved that. Still getting used to the mid-body unlock.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I am a women. I carry this knife daily and use it to accomplish daily tasks. It is very light weight and the blade holds an edge nicely. I could have gotten the next model larger. I was concerned that it would be too big. I think it would be fine and would fit in the pockets of women's blue jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Byork

customer_reviews.title: Get one now and you'll be happy you did
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a work of art and a work horse at the same time. It's so lightweight but it's still solid. Get one now and you'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough about this little knife, especially at ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this little knife, especially at this price point. If you are looking for a small EDC, you should give this consideration. If you are a collector, you should own a Spyderco Dragonfly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Spyderco Dragonfly2 ZDP-189
customer_reviews.text: I've been carrying this knife for over a month now, and love it. The only problem I've had is the screw holding the pocket clip came loose and the clip fell off. Luckily I was carrying the knife was IN my pocket and not clipped to it.
customer_reviews.author: escgoodwin

customer_reviews.title: ... knife I received was black not green but I like it so much I would not send it back
customer_reviews.text: The knife I received was black not green but I like it so much I would not send it back. it is the knife I carry all the time now. Sharp out of the box, small enough to fit in my pocket, and extremely good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mike James

customer_reviews.title: My favorite small EDC in ZDP-189
customer_reviews.text: I always have a Dragonfly in my pocket, so un-assuming in public yet such a great little tool. I bought this one to carry with my ZDP-189 Stretch. the perfect EDC combo. Everyone should have at least 3 Dragonflies collect them all!, I have.
customer_reviews.author: BigBaldGuy

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect EDC knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect EDC knife. I find myself carrying it over my benchmade just about everyday. I love the size of the knife. It's small enough that it won't intimidate people but still functional. Did I mention that this thing is LIGHT?! I almost forget I'm carrying it. Easy one handed opening with a little practice. I think everyone should have one of these. I live in the city so I can't have anything too big, it's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin Em

customer_reviews.title: great knife and steal
customer_reviews.text: I carry this every day its under the 2.5 inch federal limit for fed biudlings and i have it at a 15* .25 micron polished edge, could do surgery with this thing !! you had better have good stones to sharpen this steal, you can still do it it wil just take a while (i use shapton glass stones)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Best knife ever
customer_reviews.text: Best knife ever... literally go everywhere with it, work, gym, sleeping. Dress pants, basketball shorts even sleeping in boxers... You wont even know your carrying this!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: ... a man edc knife but the zdp blade is awesome and is sharp and strong
customer_reviews.text: Again too small for a man edc knife but the zdp blade is awesome and is sharp and strong. But hard as hell to sharpen. But I would buy it again. I'm just a delica sized edc knife for sure. This is good if your looking for something smaller
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest spyderco yet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this knife and out of the box it is by far the sharpest spyderco I own... I'm guessing it's because of the zdp steel...haven't had a chance to put it to use yet but like I said its definitely sharper than the vg-10 variety...looking forward to using this at work...gorgeous knife.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Best knife I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: If you have looked at any reviews of this knife, you have heard it is great. I was worried it would be too small. I am 6' 3" and wear size 14 shoes. I have hands to match and this little knife fits them perfectly. The blade is obscenely sharp. The clip is awesome. If you are considering this knife, you should just buy it. The only downside is now I want more Spyderco knives.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Olsen

customer_reviews.title: One of the best edc I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: One of the best edc I've ever owned. It's small enough to not know it's there and non threatening in office settings. Can be a pain to sharpen if it gets dull but proper blade maintenence will prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best of the best EDC
customer_reviews.text: The DF2 is the best EDC pocketknife. The DF2 with ZDP-189 steel is the best regular production DF2. Buy it, carry it every day - you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: fastphil

customer_reviews.title: I loved this little knife
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little knife, but it fell out of my pocket and I lost it. The wire clip helps with the weight of the pocket knife, but is not the most reliable. Be careful, unlike me!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Perfect EDC knife for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Some local town ordinances don't allow knife to be carried in pocket if blade length over 2.5 inches. Perfect weight which is very light. Sharp blade for normal tasks like opening envelopes, packages or breaking down small cardboard boxes. Racing green color and FRN handle doesn't spook anyone when they see it and pocket clip has great tension. ZDP steel is new to me so jury is out how it will hold up to rust resistance or edge chipping or tip breaking.
customer_reviews.author: David Liberge

customer_reviews.title: Spyderco Dragonfly 2
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. It's perfect for everything I have needed so far. It's fits in my fanny pack nicely and feels good in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but awesome knife for its super small size and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but awesome knife for its super small size and light weight. Fantastic every day carry knife.Ultra sharp edge. Not for intimidating purposes but can be used in an emergency as a last option deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Yang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect EDC folder
customer_reviews.text: This diminutive little folder replaced a Benchmade MiniGriptilian as my EDC. It does everything the larger knife did, except for self-defense applications. Very light, not as "scary" looking as the Benchmade, a great knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Crazy sharp out of the box - perfect size and superb quality.
customer_reviews.author: brian m

customer_reviews.title: Small, yet useful
customer_reviews.text: This was a touch small but I did like it right up till I lost it. S@#t
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent every day carry knife!
customer_reviews.text: This really is the perfect edc knife. Super light weight. Razor sharp blade. Great clip. Small enough not to scare people. I rotate several knifes but this one finds itself in my pocket more than my others. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: p. douglas humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Wow, just amazing
customer_reviews.text: Shipment was fast, as soon I got the knife I was cutting boxes with no effort. Knife came so sharp out of the box. It's so light , I forget I have it with me. The color is dark dark green, almost black , I m ok with the color. It's a beautiful knife to its size and weight. This will be my EDC at work, it's not huge and intimidating.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Burgut

customer_reviews.title: Great size and razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great size and razor sharp. Small enough to fit in my pants pocket when I'm wearing slacks and has the clip for my rear pocket when I'm wearing jeans.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Just right.
customer_reviews.text: Replace my everyday pocket knife. Great for opening boxes, etc. Good balance and the right size to put in your pocket at work and play.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: On of my favorites, Dragonfly or Caly3.. every single day.
customer_reviews.text: One of my all-time favorite knives - bought this one as a backup to my current user that's a few years old now. Simply perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dash

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little knife. Very light, making it easy to carry. The Hitachi ZDP189 blade steel is amazing – it arrived shaving sharp right out of the box. The leaf-shaped blade is small enough to be non-threatening or unobtrusive, but the thickness from cutting edge to spine give the added strength to cut through tough materials. The ergonomics of the handle do make the knife feel bigger than it is, allowing for a sure grip.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Perna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, perfect size for everyday use and sharp sharp sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Krikle

product_meta.title: Spyderco Dragonfly 2 Lightweight Signature Folding Knife with 2.28" ZDP-189 Steel Blade and High-Strength British Racing Green FRN Handle - PlainEdge - C28PGRE2
feature_bullets: DRAGONFLY 2 - The Dragonfly 2 upgrades features over the classic while keeping the important basics. Features carrying-over to the new version are the tried & tested mid-sized blade and ergonomic handle along with a front-finger choil and spine cusp.
FRN HANDLE - Fiberglass Reinforced Nylon is a polymer mixed with glass fiber then injection molded into formed and textured lightweight high-strength knife handles.
FULL-FLAT GRIND - This knife features a blade ground with flat bevels that extend from the spine all the way to the cutting edge. This grind reduces drag during cutting and decreases overall weight.
PLAINEDGE - A sharpened knife blade with no serrations or teeth sometimes referred to as a smooth blade.
SPECIFICATIONS - Closed Length (Inches): 3.33, Overall Length (Inches): 5.61, Blade Length (Inches):2.28, Blade Steel: ZDP-189, Grind: Full-Flat

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars317 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
